Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a plant that receives plenty of water, depicting it as healthy and growing with vibrant, upright leaves and flowers.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough water, showing it as wilting or struggling to grow with drooping stems and discolored leaves.
The student can identify and show patterns in their drawings that plants need water to thrive, such as consistently showing healthy plants receiving water and wilted plants lacking it.
The student can use their drawings to expertly explain that plants cannot live without water, describing the observed patterns and differences between the healthy and wilting plants.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, such as slight variations in leaf color or soil conditions, that could further enhance the depiction of plant health.

While the drawings are generally complete, the student might not label all parts consistently, which, though minor, could clarify specific symptoms of water deprivation (e.g., usually labels leaves but might forget one instance).
